data.title: DOJ Alleges Facebook Discriminated Against U.S. Workers
data.text: This is the latest in a spate of regulatory volleys against the social media platform.

data.title: Don't Underestimate the Impact of Diem on Facebook Stock
data.text: Diem, and the Diem Dollar, appears likely to make Facebook the world's free global bank. Here's what that means for FB stock.

data.title: EU's Vestager hints Big Tech will have to end 'self-preferencing' under new competition rules
data.text: The EU's competition chief has hinted that tech giants will have to change how they promote themselves as the bloc prepares to revise its competition rulebook.

data.title: Avaaz: Facebook continues to fail at flagging false and misleading posts about U.S. elections
data.text: According to nonprofit group Avaaz, Facebook is failing to flag false information about the upcoming Georgia special elections.

data.title: Facebook failed to put fact-check labels on 60% of the most viral posts containing Georgia election misinformation that its own fact-checkers had debunked, a new report says
data.text: Facebook has promised repeatedly that it would crack down on election-related misinformation. But ahead of two pivotal runoff elections in Georgia that could decide whether Republicans or Democrats control the US Senate, Facebook is still falling far short of those promises, according to a report from the nonprofit research group Avaaz.

data.title: Got $300? 3 Surefire Stocks to Buy for a Young Bull Market
data.text: It's time for opportunistic investors to put their money to work.
